revised_title: Isolation and Separation of Amino-Acid Products from Protein Hydrolysis
tldr: The authors developed a method to isolate and separate amino-acid products from protein hydrolysis. They used the "carbamate process" to separate the hydrolysis products into different groups, including dicarboxylic amino-acids, barium carbamates, and free amino-acids. They discovered new amino-acids in the hydrolysis products of plant proteins, which were previously unknown. The authors also attempted to further fractionate these amino-acids using picrates, basic lead acetate, and zinc or cadmium salts, achieving varying degrees of success.
